eu.eexcess.insa.peas

Class WeightedGraph

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jgrapht.graph.AbstractGraph<V,E>
      • org.jgrapht.graph.AbstractBaseGraph<V,E>
        • org.jgrapht.graph.SimpleGraph<V,E>
          • org.jgrapht.graph.SimpleWeightedGraph<String,org.jgrapht.graph.DefaultWeightedEdge>
            • eu.eexcess.insa.peas.WeightedGraph
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Cloneable, org.jgrapht.Graph<String,org.jgrapht.graph.DefaultWeightedEdge>, org.jgrapht.UndirectedGraph<String,org.jgrapht.graph.DefaultWeightedEdge>, org.jgrapht.WeightedGraph<String,org.jgrapht.graph.DefaultWeightedEdge>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Clique, CoOccurrenceGraph

    public abstract class WeightedGraph
extends org.jgrapht.graph.SimpleWeightedGraph<String,org.jgrapht.graph.DefaultWeightedEdge>
    A weighted graph is a set of vertices linked with weighted edges. Basic methods are added to the extended class.
    Author:
    Thomas Cerqueus
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • WeightedGraph

        public WeightedGraph()
        Default constructor.

    • Method Detail

      • incrementWeight

        public void incrementWeight(String vertex1,
                   String vertex2)
        Increments by 1 the weight between vertex1 and vertex2. Vertices are created if they don't already exist in the graph. It creates an edge if it didn't existed previously.
        Parameters:
        vertex1 - Label of a vertex.
        vertex2 - Label of another vertex.

      • addEdge

        public void addEdge(String vertex1,
           String vertex2,
           double weight)
        Creates an edge between two vertices with a given weight. Vertices are created if they don't already exist in the graph.
        Parameters:
        vertex1 - A vertex.
        vertex2 - Another vertex.
        weight - The weight between the two vertices.

      • toJsonString

        public String toJsonString()
        Converts a weighted graph into a JSON string. The result look like: [ {"term": "t1", "frequencies": [{"term": "t2", "frequency": 2}, ..., {"term": "tN", "frequency": 2}]}, ..., {"term": "tX", "frequencies": [{"term": "tY", "frequency": 5}, ..., {"term": "tZ", "frequency": 3}]} ] To limit the size of the string, the frequency between tX and tY is considered if and only if tX < tY.
        Returns:
        A JSON string representing the weighted graph.

      • getMaximalCliques

        public List<Clique> getMaximalCliques()
        Computes all the maximal cliques contained in the weighted graph. Weights are not used in the algorithm, but they are kept in the cliques.
        Returns:
        A list of maximal cliques.
